definition: lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
mud/clay/paste/pulp
restrained
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: He never procrastinates , but always takes resolute measures to solve a complicated problem in an instant.
sentences.chinese: 他幹什麼事總是快刀斬亂麻，從不拖泥帶水。

sentences.english: Draggy sales are attributed to a psychology of caution.
sentences.chinese: 拖泥帶水的銷售歸咎於謹慎的心理。

sentences.english: The loathsome love, also is only left over inexhaustible moved finally.
sentences.chinese: 拖泥帶水的愛，最後也只剩下無盡的傷感。

sentences.english: The class is god-given below today not messy, basic and punctual excellent.
sentences.chinese: 今天下班難得的不拖泥帶水，基本準時到家。

sentences.english: Eclipses call for final decisions, with no delaying the answer.
sentences.chinese: 星蝕毫無疑問是會帶來最終答案的，絕不拖泥帶水。

sentences.english: Given the extent of the cuts and transpositions , there could be no lingering over the development of character.
sentences.chinese: 因如此程度的濃縮和換位，角色的深入毫不拖泥帶水。

definition: to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
affairs of the heart/mutual relationship
to force someone to do something
to feel grateful to sb/to appreciate the kindness
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
lie/false words/nonsense/CL:篇[pian1]
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to bear grudges
indecisive/wavering
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
